basics.name: Matthew Archer
basics.label: Senior ML/Research Software Engineer
basics.summary: Computational Physicist and Senior Research Software Engineer with 7+ years' experience bridging numerical simulation and scalable Deep Learning. Specialist in coupling ML surrogates with Fortran/C++ scientific codes (e.g., FTorch) and optimising distributed training on heterogeneous HPC architectures. PhD in Physics with deep expertise in FVM and FEM solvers.

work.name: Imperial College Centre for Computational Science (ICCS)
work.summary: Technical lead on ML-climate surrogate modelling projects, coupling PyTorch models with legacy Fortran climate simulation codes.
highlights: Authored FTorch library for seamless Fortran-PyTorch coupling, enabling ML inference in production climate models
Engineered data transformation pipelines to bridge geometry mismatches between cubed-sphere simulation grids and lat-lon ML tensors
Supervised and mentored junior RSEs on distributed training best practices for ML engineering in scientific computing

work.name: University Information Services (UIS), University of Cambridge
work.summary: Led development of research computing solutions spanning CFD, FEA, and ML workloads on HPC platforms.
highlights: Designed and delivered parallel computing training (MPI, OpenMP) to 200+ researchers annually
Optimised legacy scientific codes achieving 3-10x speedup through profiling-driven refactoring and vectorisation
Provided consultancy on scalability bottlenecks for diverse research groups (engineering, climate science, biomedicine)

publications.name: Deep learning for improved global precipitation in numerical weather prediction systems
publications.summary: Co-author on ML surrogate modeling for climate applications
